TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit KoreanCalendar extends System.Globalization.Calendar

summary.span: Represents the Korean calendar.

span.span: Represents the Korean calendar.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 韩国历具有完全一样公历，只不过的年份和纪元不相同。The Korean calendar is exactly like the Gregorian calendar, except that the year and era are different. > [!NOTE] > 有关使用信息类和其他日历.NET Framework 中的类，请参阅[使用日历](~/docs/standard/datetime/working-with-calendars.md)。For information about using the class and the other calendar classes in the .NET Framework, see [Working with Calendars](~/docs/standard/datetime/working-with-calendars.md). 类只识别当前纪元。The class recognizes only the current era. 朝鲜语的日历中的闰年与公历中的相同闰年相对应。Leap years in the Korean calendar correspond to the same leap years in the Gregorian calendar. 闰年公历日历中定义为公历年份整除的由 4 个，但如果它是由 100 可除外。A leap year in the Gregorian calendar is defined as a Gregorian year that is evenly divisible by four, except if it is divisible by 100. 但是，可被被 400 的公历年是闰年。However, Gregorian years that are divisible by 400 are leap years. 平 365 年天并且初始屏幕闰年有 366 天。A common year has 365 days and a leap year has 366 days. 朝鲜历有 12 个月 28 到 31 天：The Korean calendar has 12 months with 28 to 31 days each: |GetMonth 值GetMonth value|月份Month|天数在平年Days in common years|中的天闰年Days in leap years| |--------------------|-----------|--------------------------|------------------------| |11|1 月）1월 (January)|3131|3131| |22|2 月）2월 (February)|2828|2929| |33|3 月）3월 (March)|3131|3131| |44|4 （年 4 月）4월 (April)|3030|3030| |55|5월 （5 月）5월 (May)|3131|3131| |66|6월 （年 6 月）6월 (June)|3030|3030| |77|7월 （年 7 月）7월 (July)|3131|3131| |88|8 （年 8 月）8월 (August)|3131|3131| |99|9 月9월 (September)|3030|3030| |1010|10 月10월 (October)|3131|3131| |1111|11 月11월 (November)|3030|3030| |1212|12 月12월 (December)|3131|3131| 年 2 月有 29 天在闰年在平年的第 28 天。February has 29 days during leap years and 28 days during common years. 日期到公元 2001 年 1 月 1 日The date January 1, 2001 A.D. 在公历日历中相当于朝鲜历当前纪元的年份 4334 中的年 1 月的第一天。in the Gregorian calendar is equivalent to the first day of January in the year 4334 of the current era in the Korean calendar. 每个对象支持一组的日历。Each object supports a set of calendars. 属性返回区域性的默认日历和属性返回一个包含所有支持的区域性的日历数组。The property returns the default calendar for the culture, and the property returns an array containing all the calendars supported by the culture. 若要更改使用的日历，应用程序应设置属性到新。To change the calendar used by a , the application should set the property of to a new .

span.span: Returns a that is the specified number of months away from the specified .

returns.span: The that results from adding the specified number of months to the specified .

span.span: The that results from adding the specified number of months to the specified .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 日部分的生成如果结果的日期不是有效的一天中生成月份影响。The day part of the resulting is affected if the resulting day is not a valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. 它将更改为在生成每年的生成的每月最后一个有效的一天。It is changed to the last valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. 所生成的年份部分如果外部的指定年，则结果月份受到。The year part of the resulting is affected if the resulting month is outside the year of the specified . 此实现支持仅当前纪元。This implementation supports only the current era. 因此，如果所得年份未指定纪元，将引发。Therefore, is thrown if the resulting year is outside the era of the specified . 所生成的一天时间部分保持与指定相同。The time-of-day part of the resulting remains the same as the specified . 例如，如果指定的月份是年 10 月，其中包含 31 天，指定的日期是该月第 31 天和的值`months`参数为 6，则结果年份是一个多个指定的年份，生成的月份是年 4 月，并生成 day 为 30 天，这是年 4 月的最后一天。For example, if the specified month is October, which has 31 days, the specified day is the 31st day of that month, and the value of the `months` parameter is 6, the resulting year is one more than the specified year, the resulting month is April, and the resulting day is the 30th day, which is the last day in April. 如果值`months`参数是负数，生成早于指定。If the value of the `months` parameter is negative, the resulting is earlier than the specified . 属性返回值始终等于。The property of the returned value always equals . 您可以保留属性`time`通过调用的参数方法，如以下示例所示。You can preserve the property of the `time` parameter by calling the method, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.Calendar.AddMethods#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.calendar.addmethods/cs/add1.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.Calendar.AddMethods#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.globalization.calendar.addmethods/vb/add1.vb#5)] ## Examples 下面的代码示例显示几个组成部分的值根据韩国历。The following code example displays the values of several components of a in terms of the Korean calendar. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.KoreanCalendar_AddGet#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.KoreanCalendar_AddGet/CPP/koreancalendar_addget.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.KoreanCalendar_AddGet#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.KoreanCalendar_AddGet/CS/koreancalendar_addget.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.KoreanCalendar_AddGet#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.KoreanCalendar_AddGet/VB/koreancalendar_addget.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 日部分的生成如果结果的日期不是有效的一天中生成月份影响。The day part of the resulting is affected if the resulting day is not a valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. 它将更改为在生成每年的生成的每月最后一个有效的一天。It is changed to the last valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. 所生成的月份部分保持与指定相同。The month part of the resulting remains the same as the specified . 此实现支持仅当前纪元。This implementation supports only the current era. 因此，如果所得年份未指定纪元，将引发。Therefore, is thrown if the resulting year is outside the era of the specified . 所生成的一天时间部分保持与指定相同。The time-of-day part of the resulting remains the same as the specified . 例如，年 2 月有 28 天，但在闰年时它有 29 天。For example, February has 28 days, except during leap years when it has 29 days. 如果指定的日期是闰年 2 月 29 日和的值`years`为 1，则得到的日期是第二中下一年的年 2 月 28 日。If the specified date is the 29th day of February in a leap year and the value of `years` is 1, the resulting date is the 28th day of February in the following year. 如果`years`为负，生成早于指定。If `years` is negative, the resulting is earlier than the specified . 属性返回值始终等于。The property of the returned value always equals . 您可以保留属性`time`通过调用的参数方法，如以下示例所示。You can preserve the property of the `time` parameter by calling the method, as the following example shows. remarks.format: ## Remarks 每年的日期被指从该年度的第一天的天数。The day of the year is defined as the number of days from the first day of the year. 例如，对的第一个月的第一天返回 1，和最后一天的上个月返回总天数这一年。For example, for the first day of the first month returns 1, and for the last day of the last month returns the total number of days in that year. 总是相同的值返回的。The total is the same value as that returned by . ## Examples 下面的代码示例显示几个组成部分的值根据韩国历。The following code example displays the values of several components of a in terms of the Korean calendar. summary.span: Calculates the leap month for a specified year and era.

span.span: Calculates the leap month for a specified year and era.

returns.span: The return value is always 0 because the class does not support the notion of a leap month.

span.span: The return value is always 0 because the class does not support the notion of a leap month.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在日历中支持闰月的概念，在某个特定的月份之后或在每一年中的任何月份之后发生的闰月。In a calendar that supports the notion of a leap month, the leap month can occur either after a particular month or after any month in a year. 例如，方法返回一个数字，介于 1 和 13，该值指示指定的日期与关联的月份。For example, the method returns a number between 1 and 13 that indicates the month associated with a specified date. 如果一年中，在第八个和第 9 个月之间存在闰月方法闰第八个月的 9 和 10 第 9 个月的第八个月份返回 8。If there is a leap month between the eighth and ninth months of the year, the method returns 8 for the eighth month, 9 for the leap eighth month, and 10 for the ninth month.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法可以用于通过设置确定的年份中的周数`time`年份的最后一天的参数。This method can be used to determine the number of weeks in the year by setting the `time` parameter to the last day of the year. 包含可以用于的区域性特定值`rule`和`firstDayOfWeek`参数。 contains culture-specific values that can be used for the `rule` and `firstDayOfWeek` parameters. 属性包含默认值，该值表示特定区域性，使用中指定的日历周的第一天属性。The property of contains the default value that represents the first day of the week for a specific culture, using the calendar specified in the property of . 属性包含默认值，该值定义的特定区域性，使用的日历中指定一个日历周属性。The property of contains the default value that defines a calendar week for a specific culture, using the calendar specified in the property of . 例如，在， 1 月 1 日，则返回 1。For example, in , for January 1 returns 1. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何的结果各不相同，具体取决于和使用的值。The following code example shows how the result of varies depending on the and values used. 如果指定的日期是年中的最后一天返回该年份的总的周数。If the specified date is the last day of the year, returns the total number of weeks in that year. remarks.format: ## Remarks 朝鲜语的日历中的闰年与公历中的相同闰年相对应。Leap years in the Korean calendar correspond to the same leap years in the Gregorian calendar. 闰年公历日历中定义为公历年份整除的由 4 个，但如果它是由 100 可除外。A leap year in the Gregorian calendar is defined as a Gregorian year that is evenly divisible by four, except if it is divisible by 100. 但是，可被被 400 的公历年是闰年。However, Gregorian years that are divisible by 400 are leap years. 平 365 年天并且初始屏幕闰年有 366 天。A common year has 365 days and a leap year has 366 days. 闰日是仅在闰年中发生了一天。A leap day is a day that occurs only in a leap year. 例如，年 2 月 29 日是唯一的闰日。For example, the 29th day of February is the only leap day. ## Examples 下面的示例调用五年中每个纪元的第二个月份 （年 2 月） 的最后一天。The following example calls for the last day of the second month (February) for five years in each of the eras. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.KoreanCalendar.IsLeapDay#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.KoreanCalendar.IsLeapDay/CPP/koreancalendar_isleapday.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.KoreanCalendar.IsLeapDay#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.KoreanCalendar.IsLeapDay/CS/koreancalendar_isleapday.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.KoreanCalendar.IsLeapDay#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.KoreanCalendar.IsLeapDay/VB/koreancalendar_isleapday.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 朝鲜语的日历中的闰年与公历中的相同闰年相对应。Leap years in the Korean calendar correspond to the same leap years in the Gregorian calendar. 闰年公历日历中定义为公历年份整除的由 4 个，但如果它是由 100 可除外。A leap year in the Gregorian calendar is defined as a Gregorian year that is evenly divisible by four, except if it is divisible by 100. 但是，可被被 400 的公历年是闰年。However, Gregorian years that are divisible by 400 are leap years. 平 365 年天并且初始屏幕闰年有 366 天。A common year has 365 days and a leap year has 366 days. 闰月是仅在闰年中发生的整月。A leap month is an entire month that occurs only in a leap year. 韩国历没有闰月。The Korean calendar does not have any leap months. ## Examples 下面的示例调用当前纪元中的五年中的所有每月。The following example calls for all the months in five years in the current era. MemberSignature.Value: public override int ToFourDigitYear (int year);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 ToFourDigitYear(int32 year) cil managed
Public Overrides Function ToFourDigitYear (year As Integer) As Integer

param.name: year
param.span: A two-digit or four-digit integer that represents the year to convert.

span.span: A two-digit or four-digit integer that represents the year to convert.

summary.span: Converts the specified year to a four-digit year by using the property to determine the appropriate century.

span.span: Converts the specified year to a four-digit year by using the property to determine the appropriate century.

returns.span: An integer that contains the four-digit representation of .

span.span: An integer that contains the four-digit representation of .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以通过表示的 100 年范围内定义的最后一年。 defines the last year in the 100-year range that can be represented by . 纪元确定通过查找该 100 年范围内的两位数年份的唯一匹配项。The century is determined by finding the sole occurrence of the two-digit year within that 100-year range. 例如，如果设置为 2029，则 100 年范围是从 1930年为 2029年。For example, if is set to 2029, the 100-year range is from 1930 to 2029. 因此，两位数字值为 30 被解释为 1930，而 29 两位数字值解释为 2029年。Therefore, a two-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 1930, while a two-digit value of 29 is interpreted as 2029. 支持两位数年份或四位数年份。 supports either a two-digit year or a four-digit year. 将两位数年份值 (小于 100) 传递会导致方法的值转换为一个四位数字值根据值，该值表示相应的纪元。Passing a two-digit year value (less than 100) causes the method to convert the value to a four-digit value according to the value representing the appropriate century. 如果应用程序提供在支持的日历范围到内的四位数年份值，该方法返回实际的输入的值。If the application supplies a four-digit year value that is within the supported calendar range to , the method returns the actual input value. 如果应用程序提供一个四位数字值超出了支持的日历，或者它提供了负值，则该方法将引发异常。If the application supplies a four-digit value that is outside the supported calendar range, or if it supplies a negative value, the method throws an exception.

exception.span: is outside the range supported by the calendar.

span.span: is outside the range supported by the calendar.

value.span: 可以用两位数年份表示的 100 年范围内的最后一年。

span.span: The last year of a 100-year range that can be represented by a 2-digit year.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性允许两位数年份，要正确转换为 4 位数年份。This property allows a 2-digit year to be properly translated to a 4-digit year. 例如，在公历日历中，如果此属性设置为 2029，100 年范围是从 1930年为 2029年。For example, in the Gregorian calendar, if this property is set to 2029, the 100-year range is from 1930 to 2029. 因此，为 30 的 2 位值被解释为 1930，而 29 一个 2 位数字值被解释为 2029年。Therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 1930, while a 2-digit value of 29 is interpreted as 2029. 此属性的初始值被派生自控制面板的区域和语言选项部分中的设置。The initial value of this property is derived from the settings in the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 但是，该信息可以更改的生命周期内。However, that information can change during the life of the . 类不会检测系统设置中的更改自动。The class does not detect changes in the system settings automatically. 应用程序应将此值设置为 99，以指示按字面解释 2 位数字的年份。The application should set this value to 99 to indicate that 2-digit years are to be taken literally. 例如，如果此属性设置为 99，100 年范围为 0 （不是有效值对于大多数日历而言） 和 99 之间。For example, if this property is set to 99, the 100-year range is from 0 (not a valid value for most calendars) to 99. 因此，为 30 的 2 位值被解释为 30。Therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 30.

exception.span: The value specified in a set operation is less than 99.

span.span: The value specified in a set operation is less than 99.

exception.span: -or- The value specified in a set operation is greater than .

span.span: -or- The value specified in a set operation is greater than .

exception.span: In a set operation, the current instance is read-only.

span.span: In a set operation, the current instance is read-only.
